name: SkLearn Lasso Regression
description: In Lasso Regression, Linear Model trained with L1 prior as regularizer.

fields.name: targetCol
fields.title: Target Column
fields.description: The label column for model fitting

fields.name: featureCols
fields.title: Feature Columns
fields.description: Feature columns of type - all numeric, boolean and vector

fields.name: alpha
fields.title: Alpha
fields.description: Constant that multiplies the L1 term. Defaults to 1.0. Alpha = 0 is equivalent to an ordinary least square, solved by the LinearRegression object.

fields.name: fit_intercept
fields.title: Fit Intercept
fields.description: Whether to calculate the intercept for this model. If set to false, no intercept will be used in calculations.

fields.name: normalize
fields.title: Normalize
fields.description: This parameter is ignored when `fit_intercept` is set to False. If True, the regressors X will be normalized before regression.

fields.name: precompute
fields.title: Precompute
fields.description: Whether to use a precomputed Gram matrix to speed up calculations.

fields.name: tol
fields.title: Tolerance
fields.description: The tolerance for the optimization: if the updates are smaller than `tol`, the optimization code checks the dual gap for optimality and continues until it is smaller than `tol`.

fields.name: warm_start
fields.title: Warm Start
fields.description: When set to True, reuse the solution of the previous call to fit as initialization, otherwise, just erase the previous solution.

fields.name: positive
fields.title: Positive
fields.description: When set to True, forces the coefficients to be positive.

fields.name: random_state
fields.title: Random State
fields.description: The seed of the pseudo random number generator that selects a random feature to update.

fields.name: selection
fields.title: Selection
fields.description: If set to ‘random’, a random coefficient is updated every iteration rather than looping over features sequentially by default. This (setting to ‘random’) often leads to significantly faster convergence especially when tol is higher than 1e-4.
